results.title: Baby girl
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chrissy Ponting
results.brief_description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.
results.description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.

results.title: ASHE: the way of life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Colin Colger
results.brief_description: After the death of his mother and losing his way to a life of crime, Colin, a sports loving Shepparton boy, was offered a new beginning - a lifeline - through ASHE (Academy of Health Sports and Education).

results.title: Sadek: speaking English
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of an Egyptian migrant, Sadek. The film discusses the adult education classes he attends, and the problems he has to face with his limited knowledge of English Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Teja: a Sikh priest
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”
Describes the Indian Sikh community in Woolgoolga, in New South Wales, and Teja Singh, the community priest. Explores his role in the preservation of the culture, traditions and religion of the old life in India, and his view of the necessary changes and adaptations that the future will bring.

results.title: Murawina: self help
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Murawina is an Aboriginal pre-school in Chippendale, an inner suburb of Sydney. The Aboriginal mothers who run Murawina want a separate pre-school for their children, because they want to develop in their children a black pride that may not be encouraged by the white schools the children will next go to. The film raises questions about prejudice, the influence of past experiences on present day attitudes and the relationship between urban and tribal Aborigines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

The film raises questions about prejudice, the influence of past experiences on present day attitudes and the relationship between urban and tribal Aborigines.

results.title: Mick: revisited
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Second part of a longitudinal study of Mick, an adolescent from Sydney’s western suburbs. Looks at the effects that the first film, made two years earlier, had on him and explores his attitudes towards his ethnic background. (See the first part “Mick” (Title code 012708).

results.title: Margaret: a pride in identity
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia

results.title: Kemal: a Turkish boy
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Kemal is a Turkish-born youth at school in Sydney. He has been in Australia for two years. The film shows the difficulties he experiences, particularly as they relate to language. It also illustrates the cultural background of a child from Turkey which has a strong male-oriented order and where the Islam religion is dominant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
